intro: Melocactus patens, commonly known as the spreading melon cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stem that often branches out into a bushy shape. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the warmer months, which are followed by red, berry-like fruits. Its spines are typically short and dense, providing protection from herbivores. Melocactus patens is well adapted to harsh desert conditions, storing water in its thick stem and minimizing water loss through its waxy surface.
